org.fhnw.aigs.server.gameHandling

Class GameLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.ClassLoader
      • java.security.SecureClassLoader
        • java.net.URLClassLoader
          • org.fhnw.aigs.server.gameHandling.GameLoader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class GameLoader
extends java.net.URLClassLoader
    This class is responsible is part of the plug-in mechanism. A game logic module (game) consists of two parts: Game commons and game server logic. If a player wants to initialize those games, they must be present in the gamelibs folder in the form of jars. This class provides a mechanism to retrieve those jars and the content inside the archives. It does so by providing an URLClassLoader for every game. When a new game is started loaded, the server will first check whether there is already a URLClassLoader pointing to the jar containing all the game classes. If that is not the case, a new class loader will be created and added to the allClassLoaders collection.
    v1.0 Initial release
    v1.1 Functional changes
    v1.2 Added new methods
    Version:
    1.2 (Raphael Stoeckli, 07.10.2014)

    • Field Detail

      • allClassLoaders

        private static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.net.URLClassLoader> allClassLoaders
        This field contains a reference to all ClassLoaders, and thus all classes being part of a game. The key is a string, the game's name. The key is provided by the client who requests to start a game. If the key is not identical to the name of the jar (or at least a part of the name), the game cannot be loaded. This is one of the most common mistakes. Therefore it is adviced to ensure that the game is named consistently throught all classes.

      • rebuildClasses

        public static boolean rebuildClasses()

        Returns:
        Returns true if compilation was successful, otherwise false
